intro: Vincetoxicum brevicoronatum, commonly known as the narrow-capped thornapple, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many toxic plants, and is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, orange to red berries that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
